Name: Saint Benedict of Nursia
Major_Events: Founded twelve communities for monks at Subiaco; Established the monastery at Monte Cassino; Wrote the Rule of Saint Benedict
Notable_Contributions: Founded Western Christian monasticism; Developed the Rule of Saint Benedict; Established a structured monastic lifestyle
Quotes: Prefer nothing to the love of Christ

Name: Saint Catherine of Siena
Major_Events: Mystical marriage to Christ; Received stigmata; Convinced Pope Gregory XI to return to Rome from Avignon
Notable_Contributions: Worked to bring the papacy back to Rome from Avignon; Helped establish peace among Italian city-states; Wrote "The Dialogue", a spiritual classic
Quotes: Be who God meant you to be and you will set the world on fire.

Name: Saint Joan of Arc
Birthplace: Domrémy, Duchy of Bar, Kingdom of France
Major_Events: Led French army to victory at Orléans; Facilitated coronation of Charles VII; Captured by Burgundians and sold to English; Tried for heresy and executed
Notable_Contributions: Turned tide of Hundred Years' War in favor of France; Inspired French troops and boosted morale; Became symbol of French nationalism
Quotes: I am not afraid; I was born to do this.; In God's name! Let us go on bravely!

Name: Saint Peter
Major_Events: Called by Jesus to be an Apostle; Witnessed the Transfiguration; Denied Jesus three times; Preached at Pentecost; Became leader of the early Church
Notable_Contributions: First Pope of the Catholic Church; Spread Christianity to Gentiles; Wrote two epistles in the New Testament
Quotes: Lord, you know everything; you know that I love you.

Name: Saint Paul the Apostle
Major_Events: Conversion on the road to Damascus; Three missionary journeys; Imprisonment in Rome
Notable_Contributions: Wrote several epistles in the New Testament; Spread Christianity throughout the Roman Empire; Developed Christian theology
Quotes: For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

Name: Saint Ignatius of Loyola
Birth_Name: Iñigo López de Oñaz y Loyola
Major_Events: Founded the Society of Jesus in 1534; Wrote the Spiritual Exercises; Elected first Superior General of the Jesuits in 1541
Notable_Contributions: Developed Ignatian spirituality; Established the Jesuit order; Contributed to the Counter-Reformation
Quotes: For the greater glory of God; Go forth and set the world on fire

Name: Saint Therese of Lisieux
Major_Events: Entered Carmel of Lisieux at age 15; Wrote autobiography "Story of a Soul"; Declared Doctor of the Church in 1997
Notable_Contributions: Developed the "Little Way" of spiritual childhood; Promoted a simple approach to holiness; Inspired millions through her autobiography
Quotes: My vocation is love!; Miss no single opportunity of making some small sacrifice, here by a smiling look, there by a kindly word; always doing the smallest right and doing it all for love.

Name: Saint Elizabeth Ann Seton
Patron_Of: Catholic Schools; Widows; Loss of Parents; Educators
Religious_Order: Sisters of Charity of St. Joseph's
Major_Events: Conversion to Catholicism in 1805; Founded Sisters of Charity of St. Joseph's in 1809; Established St. Joseph's Academy and Free School in 1810
Notable_Contributions: First native-born United States citizen to be canonized; Founded first American congregation of religious sisters; Established first free Catholic school in America
Quotes: The gate of heaven is very low; only the humble can enter it.

Name: Saint Vincent de Paul
Major_Events: Ordained as a priest in 1600; Captured by Barbary pirates and sold into slavery in 1605; Founded the Congregation of the Mission in 1625; Established the Daughters of Charity in 1633
Notable_Contributions: Established organizations to help the poor and marginalized; Reformed the training of priests; Pioneered social welfare programs
Quotes: We should strive to keep our hearts open to the sufferings and wretchedness of other people, and pray continually that God may grant us that spirit of compassion which is truly the spirit of God.

Name: Saint Maximilian Kolbe
Patron_Of: Drug addicts; Political prisoners; Families; Journalists; Pro-life movement
Major_Events: Founded the Militia Immaculatae in 1917; Established Niepokalanów, a Franciscan monastery, in 1927; Volunteered to die in place of a stranger in Auschwitz in 1941
Notable_Contributions: Promoted Marian devotion through publications and radio; Established missionary centers in Poland and Japan; Exemplified heroic charity by sacrificing his life for another prisoner
Quotes: No one in the world can change Truth. What we can do and should do is to seek truth and to serve it when we have found it.
